trans-unit.source: Represents a control that displays items and information in a horizontal bar in an application window.

<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar> is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl>, which means it can contain a collection of objects of any type (such as string, image, or panel).
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> class.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar> is a bar that typically displays a horizontal row of images and status information.
You can divide the items in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar> into groups that contain related items, by using <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Separator> controls.
The items in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar> can display text, graphics, or other complex content.
Items in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar> are defined as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBarItem> objects.
Events that are defined on a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBarItem> are raised when the user clicks the item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar> does not receive keyboard focus.
The following illustration shows an example of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar>.
**Status Bar**
![Status bar](~/add/media/ss-ctl-statusbar.GIF "Status bar")
Customizing the StatusBar Control
To apply the same property settings to multiple <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar> controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).

To see the parts and states that are specific to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar>, see [StatusBar Styles and Templates](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/statusbar-styles-and-templates.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in Button control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar"></xref> class.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBarItem"></xref>.
The element used to display the specified item.
Determines if the specified item is (or is eligible to be) its own container.
This method return `true` if the item is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBarItem> or a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Separator>.
The specified object to evaluate.
Returns `true` if the item is (or is eligible to be) its own container; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the custom logic for choosing a template used to display each item.

Use an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemContainerTemplateSelector> to choose different item containers if the items in your collection are the same type and you need to provide custom logic to choose the item container.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A custom object that provides logic and returns an item container.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar.ItemContainerTemplateSelector"></xref> dependency property.
Specifies an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.StatusBarAutomationPeer"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar"></xref>.
Prepares an item for display in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar"></xref>.
If the `element` is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Separator>, this method sets its <xref:System.Windows.Style>.
The item to display in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar"></xref>.
The content of the item to display.
The key that represents the style to use for <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Separator"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar"></xref>.
XAML Attribute Usage
A <xref href="System.Windows.ResourceKey"></xref> that references the style to use for <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Separator"></xref> objects.
Determines whether to apply the <xref href="System.Windows.Style"></xref> for an item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar"></xref> to an object.
This method makes sure that the style for an item in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar> is not applied to a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Separator> element.
The container for the item.
The object to evaluate.
`true` if the item is not a ; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the menu selects different item containers, depending on the type of the item in the underlying collection or some other heuristic.
This property is useful if you want to create a menu by binding to a collection.
The item container is the UI element that displays the object in a collection.

If you want to bind to a collection to create a menu that contains <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBarItem> objects and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Separator> objects, set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MenuBase.UsesItemContainerTemplate%2A> property to true and create an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemContainerTemplate> for each type of object in your collection.
Each <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemContainerTemplate> must contain either a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBarItem> or a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Separator>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` the menu selects different item containers; otherwise, `false`.
The registered default is `false`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.StatusBar.UsesItemContainerTemplate"></xref> dependency property.
